function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Conducting meta-analyses without proper consideration of study quality and bias may lead to inaccurate conclusions.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of data and misguided decision-making in public health policies.","Mitigation":"Conduct thorough quality assessments of included studies, consider publication bias, and use appropriate statistical methods to address bias.","Technologies":"Statistical software for meta-analysis, quality assessment tools, publication bias assessment tools.","People":"Public health researchers, policymakers, and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Public health research institutions, academic institutions, and government health agencies."},{"Description":"Inadequate consideration of publication bias may lead to overestimation or underestimation of treatment effects.","Impact":"Misleading conclusions about the effectiveness of interventions, leading to inappropriate healthcare decisions.","Mitigation":"Use funnel plots, Egger's regression test, and other bias assessment tools to evaluate publication bias. Consider adjustment methods such as the Trim-and-Fill test.","Technologies":"Bias assessment tools, statistical software for adjustment methods.","People":"Researchers, policymakers, and clinicians.","Owner":"Research institutions, academic institutions, and regulatory agencies."},{"Description":"Converting outcome measures to daily basis using inaccurate formulas or methods may result in flawed data analysis.","Impact":"Inaccurate interpretation of the results and inappropriate conclusions drawn from the data.","Mitigation":"Validate the accuracy of the conversion formulas used, consider consulting with statistical experts, and provide transparency in reporting the methods used for data conversion.","Technologies":"Statistical software for validation, consultation with statistical experts.","People":"Data analysts, statisticians, and researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, academic institutions, and organizations conducting data analysis."}]}
